meanings.definition: To read more or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outreading her classmates in the reading competition.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys outreading his friends by finishing books quickly.
meanings.sent3: The little girl thought she could outreading the librarian, but she was mistaken.
meanings.sent4: In the race to finish the book first, she was outreading everyone else.
meanings.sent5: His passion for outreading others made him a fast reader.

meanings.definition: The act of reading more or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outreading of the novel impressed her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The outreading of the students in the class was evident from their book choices.
meanings.sent3: The outreading of the book club members led to lively discussions.
meanings.sent4: His outreading of the newspaper every morning kept him well-informed.
meanings.sent5: The outreading of the encyclopedia helped him win the trivia contest.
